rumor_state: is broadcasting on an open frequency
scene_descriptor: recycled air that has been recycled too many times
ambient_detail: Condensation drips from cable bundles overhead.
visibility: fifty meters if you are lucky
scraper_evidence: Fresh cuts on the cable housings.
The good salvage is already gone.
scraper_behavior: They are stripping everything that is not welded down.
They work fast and they do not share.
Expect them to fight for anything with resale value.
crew_evidence: Fresh paint, fresh blood on the walls.
Sentry fires still smoldering at the junction.
The smell of cook-fires and violence.
crew_behavior: They run this stretch. Tolls are paid in teeth.
Sloppy sentries, but armed and angry.
They fight for territory like it is the only thing that matters. It is.
crew_arrival: moved in after the last crew was wiped
wave_signal: a carrier wave that should not exist
wave_behavior: The heresy of open broadcast fills the corridor like a fog.
They weaponize signal. Stay on the wire.
Expect jamming, interference, and things that ride the frequencies.
Your instruments will lie to you in their territory.
wraith_evidence: The lights flicker in a pattern that is not random.
Shadows bend where they should not.
Your feed glitches. For one frame, something is {{pick:wraith_position}}.
wraith_behavior: The junction feels wrong. Trust that feeling.
They feed on the current. Stay off the dead lines.
You will not see them until it is too late. Nobody does.
Your instruments say the area is empty. Your instruments are wrong.
automata_evidence: A maintenance drone twitches in the corner. Then another.
A cleaning unit drags itself past, chassis dented, optics {{pick:optic_state}}.
The machines here stopped taking orders {{pick:time_period}} ago.
Patrol patterns with no logic. Just predation.
automata_behavior: They patrol in patterns that make no sense to anything alive.
Rogue hardware. No override codes will help you here.
They do not hate you. They simply do not recognize you as authorized.
Fast, tireless, and running on corrupted maintenance protocols.
feeder_evidence: Insulation stripped clean for {{pick:feeder_range}} in every direction.
A nest of cable biomass blocks the main {{pick:passage}}. It pulses.
The feeders have threaded themselves through the walls.
feeder_range: as far as your light reaches
feeder_behavior: Do not trip. Do not touch bare wire.
They are chewing through the backbone. You can hear it.
They grow faster than maintenance can cut them back.
The biomass is warm. It should not be warm.
timing_line: {{if:timing=Early}}They are already here. Already set up.{{/if}}{{if:timing=Standard}}You have a narrow window to set up before they arrive.{{/if}}{{if:timing=Late}}The hostiles are late. That should worry you more.{{/if}}{{if:timing=Waves}}They come in waves. Each worse than the last.{{/if}}{{if:timing=Surge}}Everything hits at once. No escalation, just full force from the start.{{/if}}{{if:timing=Ambush}}First contact will be on their terms, not yours.{{/if}}
loot_state: {{if:loot=Scattered}}Supply caches litter the area. Someone left in a hurry.{{/if}}{{if:loot=None}}Nothing worth looting. Just the mission.{{/if}}{{if:loot=Central Cache}}Everything worth taking is piled in the center. Convenient and suspicious.{{/if}}{{if:loot=Edge Stash}}Supplies stashed along the perimeter wall.{{/if}}{{if:loot=Trail}}Gear dropped along the centerline. Breadcrumbs or bait.{{/if}}{{if:loot=Heavy Drop}}A cargo pod split open. Salvage everywhere.{{/if}}
loot_mod_line: {{if:lootMod=Standard}}Standard salvage protocols apply.{{/if}}{{if:lootMod=Decoys}}Half of it is decoys. Wasted time, wasted carry weight.{{/if}}{{if:lootMod=Timed}}The payload is on a timer. Grab it before it locks.{{/if}}{{if:lootMod=Heavy}}The salvage is heavy. Moving it will slow you down.{{/if}}{{if:lootMod=Trapped}}The caches are rigged. Check before you grab.{{/if}}{{if:lootMod=Contaminated}}The salvage is contaminated. Handle with care or do not handle at all.{{/if}}
coworker_state: {{if:coworkerMod=Standard}}Local co-workers in the area. Standard protocols.{{/if}}{{if:coworkerMod=Skittish}}The co-workers here are jumpy. One loud noise and they bolt.{{/if}}{{if:coworkerMod=Buddy System}}Co-workers stick together. Smart.{{/if}}{{if:coworkerMod=Grudge Holder}}The locals hold grudges. Cross them once.{{/if}}{{if:coworkerMod=Talkative}}The co-workers talk. Could be useful, could draw attention.{{/if}}{{if:coworkerMod=Claustrophobic}}The co-workers are on edge. Tight spaces trigger panic.{{/if}}
objective_line: Your crew needs to {{pick:generic_task}} before the {{pick:window_closes}}.
generic_task: do what you were paid for
extraction_objective: The package is somewhere in the zone. Two crews, one prize. {{pick:extraction_rule}}.
Grab the target asset and extract. {{pick:extraction_rule}}.
extraction_rule: Whoever gets it out first owns it
The other crew got the same ping
assassination_rule: Payment clears when they stop breathing
Confirm the kill or the contract voids
Clean if possible, messy if necessary
control_objective: Territory dispute. The nodes are everything. {{pick:control_rule}}.
Claim the relays. Defend the relays. {{pick:control_rule}}.
control_rule: You cannot hold all three without splitting your crew
Every node you lose is bandwidth the enemy gains
The hardware is old. It goes offline if nobody is watching
sabotage_objective: Three junction boxes. Rig them, blow them, get out. {{pick:sabotage_rule}}.
Plant the charges and hold until detonation. {{pick:sabotage_rule}}.
sabotage_rule: The charges take time to set
If they defuse even one, the operation fails
heist_objective: Loot markers everywhere. Grab what you can carry. {{pick:heist_rule}}.
The crew with the most salvage wins. {{pick:heist_rule}}.
heist_rule: Every marker you grab slows you down
breakthrough_objective: The exit is on the far side. {{pick:breakthrough_rule}}.
breakthrough_rule: Every model that makes it across counts
The enemy knows you are coming
escort_objective: The VIP is waiting. Get them to extraction. {{pick:escort_rule}}.
Protect the asset, get them across. {{pick:escort_rule}}.
escort_rule: The VIP moves on their own schedule
Everything in this zone wants them dead
uplink_objective: Boot the signal array and keep it running. {{pick:uplink_rule}}.
uplink_rule: Each node takes time. Time the enemy will use against you
The signal needs all three nodes
quadrants_objective: The zone is divided into four sectors. Control the majority. {{pick:quadrants_rule}}.
Quadrant control. Spread your crew across the zone. {{pick:quadrants_rule}}.
quadrants_rule: You cannot be everywhere at once
Bodies on the ground win this one
The enemy only needs to deny you two
seizure_objective: One objective, center of the zone. Take it and hold it. {{pick:seizure_rule}}.
Seizure job. The target is in the middle. {{pick:seizure_rule}}.
seizure_rule: Possession is the only law that matters here
Whoever holds it at the end wins
Getting there is easy. Staying is the problem
triangulation_objective: Three signal points form a triangle. Activate them in sequence. {{pick:triangulation_rule}}.
Triangulation protocol. Three nodes, specific order. {{pick:triangulation_rule}}.
triangulation_rule: The sequence matters. Get it wrong and start over
The enemy can disrupt the sequence by holding any node
lockdown_objective: Seal the zone. Lock every access point. {{pick:lockdown_rule}}.
Lockdown protocol. Shut it all down. {{pick:lockdown_rule}}.
lockdown_rule: Every unsealed door is a way in for the enemy
Lock and hold. That simple. That hard
The zone has too many access points for one crew
deployment_line: {{if:deployment=Standard}}Standard approach vectors.{{/if}}{{if:deployment=Flanked}}Same edge entry. Shoulder to shoulder.{{/if}}{{if:deployment=Corners}}Diagonal deployment. Long sightlines.{{/if}}{{if:deployment=Split}}Split entry.{{/if}}{{if:deployment=Center}}Defender holds the center.{{/if}}{{if:deployment=Crossfire}}Four entry points.{{/if}}
final: Do not die on company time.
